title: What Does "You Up?" Mean in a Text?

steps.title: A late-night â€œYou up?â€ text is a way to check if you want to hook up.
steps.content: A late-night â€œYou up?â€ text is a way to check if you want to hook up. These texts can be sent by anyone, but they most often come from guys late at night (between 10 p.m. and 2 a.m. or even later). [1] X Research source Usually, the sender is testing the waters to see if youâ€™re willing to meet up for an impromptu booty call or maybe engage in some sexting and share racy photos if the person doesnâ€™t live nearby. The text might include a flirty emoji or joke, but itâ€™s typically a pretty bare-bones message: â€œHey, you up?â€ â€œU up? ğŸ˜ˆâ€

steps.title: â€œYou up?â€ hints that he isnâ€™t super interested in a serious relationship.
steps.content: â€œYou up?â€ hints that he isnâ€™t super interested in a serious relationship. Someone who feels a real emotional or romantic connection to you probably wonâ€™t send a booty call text at 2 a.m., especially if they want to have an adult relationship with you. [2] X Research source This is especially likely if you havenâ€™t heard from him all day and then suddenly receive a raunchy request to meet up right as youâ€™re falling asleep. More likely, a â€œYou up?â€ message shows that heâ€™s mostly interested in hooking up with no strings attached. However, every relationship is different! If you have a flirtatious dynamic and spend other quality time together outside of late night hookups, a â€œYou up?â€ text could just be playful banter.

steps.content: Ignore a â€œU up?â€ text if youâ€™re not interested or to shut down the behavior. Silence is the best way to express your disinterest. Instead of typing out a response telling him to knock it off, just put your phone on â€œdo not disturbâ€ mode and get a good nightâ€™s sleep. [3] X Research source Heâ€™ll get the hint that youâ€™re not up for a booty call tonight (or possibly ever if you also donâ€™t reply in the morning).

steps.title: Or, send a thoughtful reply in the morning about how you feel about it.
steps.content: Or, send a thoughtful reply in the morning about how you feel about it. If you want to acknowledge and squash the behavior, wait until the morning to type out a reply. Keep it brief and outline your boundaries around this kind of textingâ€”mention that it makes you uncomfortable or that you donâ€™t want to get physical, and that you wonâ€™t respond to these texts in the future: â€œHey, just so you know, Iâ€™m not super comfortable with booty call texts like that. I like you as a friend, but Iâ€™m not interested in anything more than that.â€ â€œHaha, I appreciate the sentiment, but Iâ€™m not really up for random late night hookups these days. Probably not gonna answer these kinds of texts tbh.â€

steps.title: Text something unrelated in the morning to brush it off.
steps.content: Text something unrelated in the morning to brush it off. Sometimes, itâ€™s fine to forget about the text and move on with your life (especially if the â€œYou up?â€ came from a friend or someone you enjoy, but arenâ€™t interested in sexually). Just carry on your text conversations like usual and pretend the â€œU up?â€ never happened: Them: [1:48 a.m.] â€œYou up?â€ You: [9:30 a.m.] â€œHey, what time is Ginaâ€™s surprise birthday party tomorrow?â€ Them: [3:02 a.m.] â€œU up?â€ You: [2:40 p.m.] â€œOmg look at this cute raccoon gif I saw today!â€

steps.title: Send a sassy remark to show youâ€™re annoyed, but not entirely turned off.
steps.content: Send a sassy remark to show youâ€™re annoyed, but not entirely turned off. A â€œYou up?â€ text isnâ€™t the most romantic gesture in the world, but itâ€™s also not the most egregious thing a guy could send. If you want to acknowledge that youâ€™re unamused without completely writing the guy off, send a sarcastic joke or dry response to let him know you see through his hookup attempt and arenâ€™t interested right now (but maybe arenâ€™t 100% opposed to something happening in the future if he plays his cards right): [4] X Research source â€œI regret to inform you that your booty call cannot be completed as dialed.â€ â€œUnsubscribe.â€ â€œOf course, Iâ€™m always up at 2:16 a.m. waiting for you to text.â€ â€œWell I am now, dingus.â€ â€œThis is all I get? steps.title: Reply right away if youâ€™re interested in meeting up.
steps.content: Reply right away if youâ€™re interested in meeting up. Of course, if youâ€™re having a restless night and are interested in a hookup yourself, go for it! Thereâ€™s nothing wrong with a late-night booty call if you understand that it doesnâ€™t necessarily mean thereâ€™s a deeper connectionâ€”make sure youâ€™re doing it because you want to, and not to appease or get closer to whoever sent the â€œYou up?â€ text. steps.title: A â€œYou up?â€ text could be a genuine question to see if youâ€™re awake.
steps.content: A â€œYou up?â€ text could be a genuine question to see if youâ€™re awake. If you receive this text from a friend, family member, or someone youâ€™re confident has no sexual interest in you, chances are they truly want to know if youâ€™re asleep yet or not. It could be for any reasonâ€”maybe they need your help on an assignment they procrastinated on, got a flat tire and need a lift, or are just bored and wanting to goof off. Usually, theyâ€™ll let you know why theyâ€™re texting in the first message: â€œYou up? I donâ€™t understand this econ assignment at allâ€¦â€ â€œHey are u up? Iâ€™m locked out of my apartment and need a couch to crash on ğŸ¥ºâ€

steps.title: Some â€œYou up?â€ texts might be an attempt to have a heart-to-heart.
steps.content: Some â€œYou up?â€ texts might be an attempt to have a heart-to-heart. If someone you know is going through a hard time, they may just need someone to talk to if theyâ€™re alone with their thoughts and feelings. In this case, â€œYou up?â€ is just a way to see if youâ€™re available to listen or be a virtual shoulder to cry on. This kind of message could come from a friend or loved one (especially if theyâ€™ve already let you in on their problems), and theyâ€™ll probably let you know why theyâ€™re texting: â€œHey, you up? Iâ€™m spiraling right now and could use someone to talk to.â€ â€œU up? I just had a huge blowout with my parents ğŸ˜¥â€

steps.title: â€œYou up?â€ could mean a friend has something random or silly to share.
steps.content: â€œYou up?â€ could mean a friend has something random or silly to share. Weâ€™ve all got that one night owl friend who does a dayâ€™s worth of texting while youâ€™re trying to sleep.
